body: LEAD: MANHATTAN MANHATTAN Surgeons at Bellevue Hospital Center determined yesterday that they could not re-attach three fingers of a Parks Department employee that were severed when he attempted to unclog an ice machine. title: Metro Datelines; Surgery Ruled Out For Injured Worker

body: LEAD: A long road has become even longer in the 1986-87 season. Those in New York City and on Long Island who want to follow the Grand National path through club, local, district and national competition to possible world honors must start now, instead of at Thanksgiving. body: LEAD: A mother shot her two daughters early yesterday as they slept in their home in the Kensington Park section of Brooklyn, the police said. The girls, Josette Booker, 13 years old, and Alicea, 18, were listed in critical condition at Kings County Hospital. Their mother, Marjorie Booker, 43, was arrested and charged with attempted murder, the
title: Mother Is Held in Shootings

body: LEAD: A man the police called a ''known terrorist'' who is wanted in connection with at least seven murders was captured late Tuesday by officers who chased him into a Brooklyn alley after a shooting, the police said. body: LEAD: A 20-year-old Brooklyn man was arrested yesterday and charged with raping and robbing six women over the last two years, the police said. He is a suspect in four other rapes. title: Brooklyn Man Held in Rapes; Police Link Him to 10 Attacks

body: LEAD: WHEN Bill Dillard was not on the road, singing and acting in musicals or playing his trumpet with Louis Armstrong, he lived in rental apartments in Harlem.
